sentences: Kas on seda võimalik iial unustada?
Kuhu ta iial läks, võeti teda sõbralikult vastu.
Kui iial võimalust, oli nooruk kindel matkaja.
context: The Estonian word 'iial' is an adverb that means 'never' or 'ever'. It's commonly used in negative sentences to express that something will never happen, has never happened, or under no circumstances. The dictionary shows it can also appear with the suffix '-gi' as 'iialgi' (meaning 'also never') and is sometimes used interchangeably with 'kunagi' (ever). In positive contexts, it can emphasize 'at any time' or 'under any circumstances'. It's an important negation marker in Estonian similar to how 'never' functions in English.
